required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hyperosmolar Saline Irrigation Fluid in Arthroscopic Knee Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Hyperosmolar Saline Irrigation Fluid in Arthroscopic Knee Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: An isotonic solution, such as saline (0.9%, 300mOsm/L) or lactated ringer's (273 mOsm/L), is commonly used and safely proven for joint irrigation during arthroscopy. Arthroscopic fluid is usually pressurized to enable visualization through dilation of the joint or bursa and prevent bleeding from the microvasculature. It has been recommended that this pressure be maintained at 49mmHg or less below the systolic blood pressure to preserve the clarity of view. The combination of large amounts of pressurized irrigation solution and lengthy arthroscopic procedures may cause substantial tissue fluid retention. Thus, extravasation of irrigation fluid into the periarticular tissues is inevitable and may create technical difficulties as well as patient morbidity and complications. Previous investigators have reported complications including tracheal obstruction, post-operative airway edema and compromise leading to prolonged intubation, excess weight gain, neurologic injuries, skin necrosis, and fluid overload associated with excessive fluid extravasation and tissue retention. Furthermore, it has been shown that fluid accumulated during the operation is slowly released back into the systemic circulation. Although there is not a rapid change in circulating volume, there may be implications for elderly patients and those with multiple comorbidities during prolonged arthroscopic surgery. Therefore the investigators seek to determine if a hyperosmolar solution, similar to what is used in head trauma patients, can reduce the degree of fluid extravasation in knee arthroscopy. The investigators also seek to determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative knee pain compared to the standard isotonic solution. The third objective is to determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative pain medicine consumption compared to the standard isotonic solution.

primary_outcome.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution, similar to what is used in head trauma patients, can change the degree of fluid extravasation in knee arthroscopy.

secondary_outcome.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative knee pain (Visual Analogue Scale; 0-10; 0= no pain; 10= worst pain imaginable) compared to the standard isotonic solution.
To determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative pain medicine consumption compared to the standard isotonic solution.

arm_group.description: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR.

Lactate Ringer's (LR, 273mOsm/L) is commonly used at our facility as our isotonic standard irrigation solution and will serve as the control to be evaluated against a hyperosmolar (1.9%, 600mOsm) solution.

intervention.description: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (18 years of age or greater) undergoing arthroscopic knee surgery who are willing and able to consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Unable to give consent
- Prisoner
- Mentally Disabled

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Fluid Extravasation
outcome.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution, similar to what is used in head trauma patients, can change the degree of fluid extravasation in knee arthroscopy.
outcome.population: Change in Knee Girth (cm)= Postoperative knee girth- preoperative knee girth

group.title: Hyperosmolar Saline
group.description: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR. Hyperosmolar Saline: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR.

group.description: Lactate Ringer's (LR, 273mOsm/L) is commonly used at our facility as our isotonic standard irrigation solution and will serve as the control to be evaluated against a hyperosmolar (1.9%, 600mOsm) solution. Normal saline: Lactate Ringer's (LR, 273mOsm/L)

measure.title: Fluid Extravasation
measure.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution, similar to what is used in head trauma patients, can change the degree of fluid extravasation in knee arthroscopy.
measure.population: Change in Knee Girth (cm)= Postoperative knee girth- preoperative knee girth

outcome.title: Postoperative Pain
outcome.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative knee pain (Visual Analogue Scale; 0-10; 0= no pain; 10= worst pain imaginable) compared to the standard isotonic solution.
outcome.population: Visual Analogue Score (0-10) for the first three postoperative days.

group.title: Hyperosmolar Saline
group.description: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR. Hyperosmolar Saline: The hyperosmolar solution will be created by adding 120cc of 23.4% NS solution to a 3L bag of LR.

group.description: Lactate Ringer's (LR, 273mOsm/L) is commonly used at our facility as our isotonic standard irrigation solution and will serve as the control to be evaluated against a hyperosmolar (1.9%, 600mOsm) solution. Normal saline: Lactate Ringer's (LR, 273mOsm/L)

measure.title: Postoperative Pain
measure.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative knee pain (Visual Analogue Scale; 0-10; 0= no pain; 10= worst pain imaginable) compared to the standard isotonic solution.
measure.population: Visual Analogue Score (0-10) for the first three postoperative days.

outcome.title: Opioid Consumption
outcome.description: To determine if a hyperosmolar solution has any effect on post-operative pain medicine consumption compared to the standard isotonic solution.
outcome.population: Pain medication consumption on postoperative days 1, 2, and 3 as measured in morphine equivalent units

reported_events.desc: A member of the research team was responsible for documenting any perioperative adverse events that occurred prior to discharge. A retrospective review of the electronic medical records was performed to identify any adverse events that occurred within the first 30 days following surgery.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
